# Draft:Katie Edwards (photographer)

: Which nations, and how? Hoary (talk) 23:20, 25 October 2025 (UTC)}}
----
| birth_place   = Leicester, United Kingdom

| notable_works = Portrait of America

}}
Katie Edwards (born 1 June 1996) is a photographer and visual artist, based in London. Her work includes photography, storytelling and journalism. It has been featured in the BBC, The Times, and various other outlets.
Career
After her early work in journalism and photography, Edwards gained international attention for her project of capturing the United States through the train window in 2024, which she completed with her dad. The work is exhibited at the Observatory Gallery, London, from 26 September 2025 to 30 April 2026.
In 2025 she embarked on another journey, this time with the goal of photographing 42 countries in Europe through the train window.
